newsitem.title: GERMANY: German official - bourse float of Postbank preferred.
newsitem.headline: German official - bourse float of Postbank preferred.

text.p: The German official who represents the state's 100 percent stake in Postbank, the bank currently tied to the German postal system, insisted on Friday that a bourse flotation of the business was the preferred option.
But Hans Gottfried Bernrath, head of the Federal Institute for Post and Telecommunications, said on German radio a sale of Postbank to a large institution could not be ruled out.
An offer by Dresdner Bank 18 months ago was however rejected, he said.
Bernrath was speaking after Dresdner denied media reports that it was interested in buying a majority in Postbank.

He said there were no plans for any deal with Dresdner. He said a working paper on Postbank prepared by British investment house Schroders had simply mentioned its name as an example in hypothetical situations.
